fields.Title of Presentation: Prebriefing in Simulation: Does Reflection-Before-Action Improve Student Learning Outcomes
fields.Conference / Meeting Name: Nurse Educators Conference in the Rockies
fields.Description/Abstract:
Poster presentation submitted and selected for presentation at a national nurse educator's conference presenting to approximately 300 attendees.

Abstract:
While simulation is crucial in providing additional clinical practice hours for students in undergraduate nursing education, the prebriefing phase has been significantly understudied. Prebriefing may provide a vital opportunity for students to reflect-before-action prior to participating in simulation thus improving student learning outcomes. Exploring the relationship between prebriefing structure and student learning outcomes may allow faculty to ensure simulation learning outcomes are more readily  met.
